review_blob: Holy smokes, what a Hefe!!  Best Ive ever had.  Rich, creamy, loaded with banana, cloves, and citrus...  Very strong as well.  Careful with this one...
beer_name: New Glarus Thumbprint Series Imperial Weizen

review_blob: Very good Hefe!!!  Loaded with bananas, cloves, and a sweet citrusy aroma and flavor...
Probably my favorite sweet stout... Very smooth and creamy and tastes great.. Very drinkable brew that I always try to have a few of...
Pretty good brew... Not spectacular but good...  Sort of Guinness like but maybe a little tastier...
Very underrated brew in my opinion.  This was a great little IPA!!  Hoppy as hell yet balanced by a smooth maltiness...  Very nice little brew..
Awesome porter from Left Hand!  Very dark, rich, and smoky with hints of chocolate and coffee... The smoke wasnt overpowering which was nice.  A sipper thats damn tasty!
beer_name: Left Hand SmokeJumper Imperial Smoked Porter

review_blob: Utterly delicious porter here especially when it warmed up.  Lots of chocolate, roasted malts, dark fruit, and the merest hint of wood smoke evident in this one.  Another great offering from Stone...
Very nice little brew from the Great Lake boys....  Deliciously malty with a hint of fruitness on the finish...  Beautiful to look at in the glass...  A good Irish ale..
Very good offering from Smuttynose here...  Nice, dark, and full of roasted malt and chocolate flavors, I found this to be a really good porter and one I could drink quite easily again.

The appearance and aroma made me think that this could be a really great brew... I was wrong.  Its essentially a glorified wine cooler.  Way, way too sweet and not very drinkable.  I could see this as a teenage girls first experiment with alcohol..

Overall, this has replaced Two Hearted as my favorite IPA.  Loaded with pungent, oily hoppy goodness, this is a delicious brew.  Never astringent or boozy, it typifies an IPA to me.  I love this brew.
Good little brew here... Very dark and full of roasted malt flavor, this stout typifies what a milk stout should be... Good tasting but not too rich..
Nice little pils here...  Had on tap at brewpub..  Nice and crisp, with a slight hoppiness, this brew was great with my patty melt.
beer_name: Smoky Mountain Old Thunder Road Pilsner

review_blob: Great little porter here....  Had on tap at brewery...  Nice, dark, rich, delicious.... Everything a porter should be..
Pretty decent little brew here... Good example of the style...  Dark and malty with a nice sweetness, it went well with my patty melt..

I would classify this as more of an American Strong.  This reminded me quite a bit of Double Bastard which is a good thing.  Wonderfully hoppy yet loaded with sweet malts, this brew really hit the spot.  Delicious...

This is a really hyped brew and Im glad I got the chance to try it but it was way too one dimensional for me.  Im a hop lover so it smelled great, probably the best smelling IPA that Ive ever had, but theres no malt presence at all.  Its just bitter, bitter, bitter....  Guess Im in the minority but there are much better IPAs out there.

Just an OK brew for me.  I had the Wailing Wench from Middle Ages a bit earlier and it was much better and hoppier.  This was a good brew but I was expecting a hoppy bitter taste and it was more malty and sweet...
beer_name: Middle Ages X Double India Pale Ale

review_blob: Really kick ass little brew here.  It had everything that I look for in an American Strong.. sweet malts, a little earthiness and funkiness, and a blast of hops at the end.  This brew has grabbed a spot on my top 3 American Strongs.  I finished this bomber in record time.

Not a big fan of this brew...  Looks ok, but has loads of sediment...  Nothing offensive about the odor but theres not much of one.  Extremely bitter taste and Im not sure its from the hops... Down the drain with this one...
Fairly average porter here.  Pretty good chocolatey taste but a little too thin even for a porter.  I liked this one but it isnt a favorite of the style.

I seemed to have liked this one quite a bit more than some others have.  This one didnt have much of an aroma, very faintly hoppy but it sure didnt disappoint in the taste department.  Extremely hoppy and a huge bitter finish make this one super tasty!
Not the biggest wheat fan but this was ok.  Nice, light, and citrusy.  Lots of floaters but no big deal.  Fairly smooth going down.

A fabulous brew by Smuttynose here....

Rich, dark, and loaded with chocolate and dark fruits, it has a very nice thickness and packs a heck of a punch at 10 ABV as well.
beer_name: Smuttynose Big Beer Series: Imperial Stout

review_blob: One of my favorite Sam Adams offerings...  Very malty and dark with a hint of smokiness from the peat, this brew is my favorite out of the Brewmasters collection...  I wish this was avaiable year round..

This one was a little boozy..quite hot...  Looked as good as any stout Ive ever had.. Aroma of dark roasted malt and bittersweet chocolate, nice...

Again, prevalent alcohol taste but loaded with chocolate and malt too..

Needs some aging and I have 5 more to put back..
beer_name: Thirsty Dog Siberian Night Imperial Stout

review_blob:
Very good brew...


Golden pour, fluffy head... Looks like honey...

Aroma is balanced hops and malts...

Great hoppy taste with sweet malts and a great bitter finish..

Found a sixer of this at a local gas station and had to give it a shot.

Clear golden pour with a pretty good head.  The aroma isnt nearly as filled with strawberry as I was hoping.  Very, very faint aroma of berries with the usual lager yeastiness.

Fairly average tasting lager with the exception of a metallic aftertaste and the faintest of berry flavors.  Just ok to me.

Nice little session brew here...

Murky amber brew with a small head.  Looks like a barleywine.

Aroma of sweet malts and a little hops.  Interesting..

Great taste and mouthfeel of sweet malts, caramel, something fruity, and a little hops..

Nice brew..
beer_name: Rush River The Unforgiven Amber Ale

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: Pretty good little session brew here..  Clear golden appearance and surprisingly malty aroma lead to a better than average taste of some sweet malts, biscuits and a little hop finish.  Better than average session lager.

Holy smokes, this is a great brew!  Second only to the Kentucky Breakfast in my book.

Dark and foreboding, this coffee laden stout hits the spot.  Loads of dark strong coffee and chocolate both in the aroma and flavor make this a memorable brew.  

I loved it and wish I had access to this one .

Huh?  I dont understand the low scores with this one.  I loved it!

Beautiful clear dark amber coloring with good carbonation, this brew is eminently drinkable.  Very dark and malty, its a touch sweet but not overly so and could easily be a common session brew for me.  I even detect a little coffee in this one.

I enjoyed this one a lot.  This is my first Jolly Pumpkin brew and I was a little apprehensive but not any more.

Murky brown pour with a very impressive head, this ale smells of sour fruit, some malt, and something sort of funky which I like.

Nice and sour on the finish, this is very drinkable and a big surprise.  I liked this a lot and drank every bit of it.

Great!

How this isnt in the top 10, Ill never know.  This is the best Imperial Stout Ive ever had.  

Jet black with a small foamy head, this brew smells wonderful with loads of chocolate, coffee, and the touch of bourbon.  

Taste is more of the same.  Its just better than the rest that Ive tried.  

Unbelievable..

This was a strange brew for me.. almost had the characteristics of a barleywine at first and then as it warmed, it became more IIPA-like.

Murky, murky brackish brown color, no head.  This wasnt the most attractive of brews..

Aroma of sweet malts at first then as it warmed, the hops started to show up..

Sweet, syrupy malts big time when this is cold, not much of a hop presence.. as it warms, it seems to reverse and become one dimensional the other way..

This was a nice brew to try but its definitely not one of my favorites or anything... I dont get it..

Very nice hefe here...the bottle I got was just a little skunky but it didnt affect the flavor too much.  Looked really good, nice and cloudy but as I said the smell was a little skunk mixed with banana and a biscuity smell.  Taste was great, just like a good banana nut bread. 

Overall, I liked this one.
This one was just a little thin for my taste.  Had a very good coffee presence, smelled great but was more like a porter.  I love porters but not when Im expecting a stout.

What a delicious brew this one is..its loaded with rich dark chocolate taste, a velvety mouthfeel, wonderful aroma and enough alcohol to make you wet your britches if you aint careful.....I loved it..

Actually had this on tap at the Memphis location..

Clear golden pour, fluffy head and some of the most impressive lacing Ive ever seen.  

Aroma of sweet malts and maybe a little floral to it.. Doesnt smell as hoppy as I was expecting..

Starts out sweet with the malts and explodes into a hoppy citrusy bomb on the finish..  Still, for a brew called HopGod, I was expecting something much hoppier.  Its good but not great.

Not a world class porter but its a pretty good one...

Not quite black, but a nice deep brown..

Aromatics include roasted chocolate malts, some sweet fruit, and maybe even a little coffee..

Moderately creamy mouthfeel with a nice chocolate taste and some smokiness..

Pretty good brew, coolest label Ive ever seen...

Picked this one up a few days ago on a beer run...

Pours a beautiful clear amber color with a tremendous fluffy white head that laces the heck out of the glass..

Aroma of some malt and a faint hoppiness... slightly piney and a bit of citrus as well..

Very smooth taste of faint hops and sweet malts... nice bitterness on the finish that makes this nice...

Another good Great Lakes brew...

The liquor store close to the house here just recently picked this one up so I had to give it a shot. 


Pours a beautiful coppery reddish color with a very persistent light cream colored head.  


Aroma is of sweet dark fruit and booze soaked cherries.  A bit of a boozy aroma here. 


Way too much carbonation in the mouthfeel of this one.  Taste is of booze, some cherries, some dark fruit, and maybe a little oak or something kind of woody.  


Not a favorite after having this.  It was just OK.

My first Founders brew...

Wow, what a beautiful IPA!  Coppery orange color with a very fluffy white head.. Seems darker than other IPAs..

Huge, pungent aroma of piney hops thats really nice...  Maybe the best smelling IPA yet..

Hmmm... Taste definitely doesnt match the aroma.  Very malty and tea-like up front which leads to a lingering bitterness on the finish.  I was hoping for a Two Hearted experience and just didnt get it.  It looks the part and smells the part, but it ends there.  Its good but just not great like I was hoping.

What an absolutely incredible brew this is...  Dark and chocolatey all the way with hints of coffee and malt, this beer is the best of the Great Lakes offerings that Ive had so far.   Its loaded with flavor and has a bite that will black that ass out if you aint careful.

The wifey and I thoroughly enjoyed this brew while watching the kiddies play put in the snow...

This is deep space black with a decent caramel head..

Strong aroma of chocolate and espresso with an underlying current of vanilla and oak..

Espresso dominates the palate followed by chocolate and dark roasted malts...  Delicious..

This was a special treat that Im glad I got to try...
beer_name: Pennichuck Pozharnik Espresso Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: This brew is way underrated in my opinion.  Nice deep brown coloring and smells like most of the better brown ales that Ive had.  Very smooth sweet taste that is loaded with malt and has a definite cocoa flavor to it as well.  I liked it.

Absolutely the best oatmeal stout that Ive ever tried....

Pours out into my Sierra Nevada pint glass with a much thicker than expected consistency and its midnight black... very impressive...

Heavenly aroma of extremely strong coffee, oatmeal, chocolate, and some sweet dark fruit as well...

Simply divine flavors in this brew... it is loaded with coffee and chocolate with the dark fruit and oatmeal lingering around in the background... one thing that strikes me is that the coffee is not overdone in this one unlike lots of other coffee stouts that Ive had...

This is one incredible brew and sets the standard for other oatmeals in my book..

Bottled Jan. 30, 08 so this should be very fresh...  Not quite black but lets say a very very dark brown....  Smells a lot like a very dark coffee with chocolate and and maybe some vanilla notes thrown in as well...  Wow, this is a deliciously creamy brew....it pours much thinner than it feels, I can say that..  Awesome taste of coffee and chocolate and smokiness....simply delightful...seriously, if I could get this where I lived, it would be my go to winter brew...  Just amazing...

Very average brew in my opinion...

Very murky orange pour, really good head...

Smells faintly like apricots, mostly of malt....no hops....

Hmmmm....not at all what I was expecting with a name like Aprihop... Not hoppy at all... Tastes like old dried apricots and some malt....  

Drain pour all the way here.  I tried to like this and just couldnt.

This is one of the better browns that Ive had.  

Pretty dark for a brown, nice fluffy head.

Pleasant caramel malt aroma, rather sweet smelling..

Sweet, bready, malty taste that is nice and smooth.

Not a big fan of the style but this is a good one.
